title: What is under the animal kingdom? - Quora

response.answer_text: If by UNDER you mean more general categories of life, this is now considered as the three Domains. Animals, as well as plants, belong to the Eukarya domain. This is the only domain whose members’ cells, uni or multi, have developed a cell nucleus, and which has successfully led to multicellular organisms. The other two Domains describe bacteria and other bacteria-like organisms. One step “under” DOMAIN is all of LIFE, or the biomass. The Virus and the the Prion are still considered Not-Life by most biologists. Except for zombies, most people are alive…
Everything. All micro and macro organisms.
